intro: Selaginella rabenavii, commonly known as the Lepidophyllum, is a species of spikemoss native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in rocky crevices and dry soils, showcasing a unique ability to survive in harsh conditions. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its fleshy, scale-like leaves and a branching, upright stem. It produces microspores and megaspores on separate structures, which is a characteristic feature of the spikemoss family. Selaginella rabenavii is also notable for its ability to undergo desiccation tolerance, allowing it to remain viable for long periods in dry environments.
